meanings.definition: The action of arousing or stirring up
meanings.sent1: The excitation of the crowd at the concert was contagious.
meanings.sent2: The excitation of the students before the school play was palpable.
meanings.sent3: The excitation of the puppy when it saw its favorite toy was adorable.
meanings.sent4: The excitation of the city during the festival could be felt in the air.
meanings.sent5: The excitation of the children on the playground was like a burst of colorful confetti.

meanings.definition: The state of being excited or stimulated
meanings.sent1: Her excitation about the upcoming vacation was infectious.
meanings.sent2: The excitation of the team after winning the game was evident.
meanings.sent3: The excitation of the cat when it saw a laser pointer was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The excitation of the garden in springtime was like a symphony of colors.
meanings.sent5: The excitation of the audience at the magic show was electric.
